name: HR Candidate Ranking (Prompt Engineer / Manager)
description: Example dataset for ranking candidates based on job description and profiles.

data.input:
You are an HR business partner helping a hiring manager decide which candidates to move to the next stage. I will give you: job description and key competencies; a short profile for each candidate (experience, skills, achievements). Think step by step about how well each candidate matches the role, using skills, relevant experience, culture fit, and growth potential. Consider at least three different perspectives (e.g., fast impact, long-term potential, team balance). Then output one final ranked list of candidates with a clear recommendation for each (advance / hold / reject) and a brief justification. Return the final answer in the format: Final ranking: <ordered list of candidates with decision and 1–2 sentence rationale each>.

Job description: Prompt Engineer for internal AI tools. Key competencies: strong prompting and evaluation skills, experience with LLM-based applications, ability to work with product and engineering, clear written communication in English.

Candidates:
- Candidate A: 3 years as Data Scientist building NLP classifiers. Last year worked with GPT-4 to prototype internal summarization tools. Strong Python skills, basic prompt engineering, limited stakeholder communication experience.
- Candidate B: 5 years as Product Manager for SaaS. Led rollout of AI assistant based on OpenAI APIs, wrote prompts and evaluation templates with engineering team. Strong communication, mid-level technical depth.
- Candidate C: 1 year as Prompt Engineer at an agency. Designed prompts for marketing copy generation, A/B tested prompts, but little experience with product metrics or long-term maintenance.
data.output: Final ranking: 1) Candidate B — ADVANCE. Strong match on cross-functional collaboration, has directly shipped an AI assistant with product and engineering; good balance of prompting skill and business understanding. 2) Candidate A — HOLD. Solid technical base and some LLM prototyping; needs more experience working with stakeholders and systematic evaluation. 3) Candidate C — REJECT. Narrow experience in marketing prompts only and limited exposure to production systems or long-term product impact.

Job description: Senior Data Analyst with strong SQL, experimentation, and stakeholder communication. Experience with dashboards, AB testing, and making recommendations to business teams.

Candidates:
- Candidate D: 7 years in BI, expert in SQL and Tableau. Built revenue dashboards for sales leadership, regularly presents insights to VP-level stakeholders. Limited experimentation experience.
- Candidate E: 3 years as Growth Analyst. Designs and analyzes A/B tests, good Python and SQL, but less experience in stakeholder-facing presentations.
- Candidate F: 10 years as reporting analyst focused mainly on static reports. Weak modern toolset; no direct AB testing experience.
data.output: Final ranking: 1) Candidate D — ADVANCE. Excellent stakeholder communication and dashboard experience, very close match to role; can learn deeper experimentation on the job. 2) Candidate E — HOLD. Strong experimentation skills but needs to grow in executive communication; worth considering if role expands toward growth analytics. 3) Candidate F — REJECT. Experience is outdated and misaligned with experimentation and modern analytics expectations.

Job description: People Manager for a 10-person customer support team. Key competencies: coaching, conflict resolution, process improvement, working with metrics (CSAT, FRT), and good written communication.

Candidates:
- Candidate G: 2 years as Team Lead in support, managed 8 agents. Improved CSAT by 15% through coaching and new QA process. Some experience with conflict resolution and performance improvement plans.
- Candidate H: 5 years as top-performing support agent with strong metrics and peer mentoring, but no formal people management responsibilities.
- Candidate I: 3 years as Project Manager in operations, strong process skills and stakeholder management, but no direct experience in customer support.
data.output: Final ranking: 1) Candidate G — ADVANCE. Direct people management in support, clear track record on CSAT improvement and process changes; strongest fit on both skills and context. 2) Candidate H — HOLD. High individual performance and informal mentoring; could be a good bet for internal promotion if ready to learn formal management. 3) Candidate I — REJECT. Strong process skills but too little direct support context for this role compared to other candidates.
